document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Depending on the severity of the disease, the doctor will prescribe different treatment methods for acute gastritis.
Specifically includes:
1. Use medication
Medicines to treat acute gastritis include both prescription and non-prescription types. Normally, your doctor may prescribe a combination of drugs to ensure the best results, including:
Antacids (aluminum phosphalugel or magnesium hydroxide): This type is used to neutralize stomach acid. In case of necessity, the doctor may prescribe a dose to take several times a day.; H2 antagonists (Famotidine (Pepcid), Cimetidine (Tagamet)...): This type is used to reduce stomach acid secretion, can be taken 10 - 60 minutes before eating or before going to bed.; Proton pump inhibitors (Omeprazole (Prilosec), Esomeprazole (Nexium)…): Drugs that inhibit stomach acid production, should only be used every 24 hours and usually taken 30 – 60 minutes before meals.; Antibiotics for infections caused by Helicobacter Pylori bacteria: Amoxicillin, Tetracycline (should not be used in children under 12 years old) and Clarithromycin.
Antibiotics can be used at the same time as antacids, H2 antagonists, and Proton pump inhibitors. Treatment usually lasts from 10 to 28 days. However, in all cases, patients need to discuss carefully with their doctors about medication use to minimize unwanted problems.(3)
2. Change your lifestyle
Changing daily living habits in a healthy, balanced way can also contribute to improving acute gastritis. Some useful solutions include:
Limit alcohol consumption as much as possible; Quit smoking.; Control emotions, avoid stress; Lose weight if your body is overweight.
3. Change your diet
To reduce symptoms of acute gastritis, patients should pay attention to their daily diet:
Avoid foods that contain a lot of spices, grease, sour, and hot foods because they can easily irritate the stomach.; Divide meals into smaller portions throughout the day.; Actively supplement foods that are good for the stomach: bananas, coconut water, yogurt, vegetables, ginger, cereals...
